author: ralexstokes
content:
there is already ETH there so we don't need to worry about this edge case AFAIK

also after talking to <@360491619402776577> the preferred approach is to not include ETH when deploying the precompile

author: _shemnon
content:
From the yellow paper:
> An account is empty when it has no code, zero nonce
> and zero balance:
> (14) EMPTY(σ, a) ≡ σ[a]c = KEC(())∧σ[a]n = 0∧σ[a]b = 0
> Even callable precompiled contracts can have an empty
> account state. This is because their account states do not
> usually contain the code describing its behavior.
So precompile logic should trip regardless of account state.
